A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie spits in the face of anyone who has any attachments to the original trilogy. All of the original main characters are destroyed by completely reversing any character development that occurred in episodes 4-6. Assumingly just to make room for Ray (an even bigger Mary Sue now than before) and her uninteresting friends. \n\nThe closest thing this story had to any kind of character development was Fin\, but they stole that from him with a very awkward forced \"love\" dynamic. Can't even remember Fin's new girlfriends name. This whole movie is entirely forgettable. Maybe that's a good thing so we cn keep our sanity after what they did to this franchise.
